description: From search +‎ light. Compare West Frisian sykljocht (“searchlight”), Dutch zoeklicht (“searchlight”), Danish søgelys (“searchlight”), Swedish sökarljus (“searchlight”).

entries.meaning: A light source that projects a bright beam of light in any direction, generally for military use.
The light from the above source.

verbs.description: searchlight (third-person singular simple present searchlights, present participle searchlighting, simple past and past participle searchlighted)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To scan or sweep across like a searchlight.
examples: A dozen air corps of fireflies searchlighted the spot for an instant.
